Posts.Content: Bluebell22 wanted to share some good news with you. Yesterday I rang the bell for my last chemo and my post chemo mri shows no cancer remaining, just scar tissue. Surgery scheduled early March. Can you believe I finally got there!! Just a bit nervous about how much this last chemo is going to kick me in the face! Hope all’s well with you xx
Posts.Title: Fed Up!!

Posts.Content: Bluebell22 wanted to share some good news with you. Yesterday I rang the bell for my last chemo and my post chemo mri shows no cancer remaining, just scar tissue. Surgery scheduled early March. Can you believe I finally got there!! Just a bit nervous about how much this last chemo is going to kick me in the face! Hope all’s well with you xx
Posts.Title: Fed Up!!

Posts.Content: Congrats Bluebell. The worst is over. Hope you’re not too sore x
Posts.Title: Fed Up!!

Posts.Content: Oh I see. Lucky you   Thanks x
Posts.Title: Fed Up!!

Posts.Content: Will do, thanks xx
Posts.Title: Fed Up!!

Posts.Content: Thanks Bluebell22 Fingers crossed the pathology on the surgery matches the MRI. I honestly couldn’t believe my ears when I got the news. Was totally convinced there would still be something there. But no just scar tissue apparently. It will be nice to start focusing on normal general life rather than whether or not I’m shrinking fast enough! Thanks for the good wishes and I’m pleased things are going well for you xx
Posts.Title: Fed Up!!

Posts.Content: Oh I see. Lucky you   Thanks x
Posts.Title: Fed Up!!

Posts.Content: Will do, thanks xx
Posts.Title: Fed Up!!

Posts.Content: Thanks TheScriptFan i did it!! Yes I think the fatigue will be the hardest part and will probably stick around for a long time after. Felt very unmotivated to do the last one after the good news too. No wonder they wait till the end to tell you! Xx
Posts.Title: Fed Up!!

Posts.Content: I didn’t realise they kept you overnight for lumpectomy. Definitely will be nice to have your own bed back. I’m doing ok. Fingers crossed I’m starting second half of chemo tomorrow x
Posts.Title: Fed Up!!

Posts.Content: Thanks TheScriptFan i did it!! Yes I think the fatigue will be the hardest part and will probably stick around for a long time after. Felt very unmotivated to do the last one after the good news too. No wonder they wait till the end to tell you! Xx
Posts.Title: Fed Up!!

Was totally convinced there would still be something there. But no just scar tissue apparently. It will be nice to start focusing on normal general life rather than whether or not I’m shrinking fast enough! Thanks for the good wishes and I’m pleased things are going well for you xx
Posts.Title: Fed Up!!

Posts.Content: I didn’t realise they kept you overnight for lumpectomy. Definitely will be nice to have your own bed back. I’m doing ok. Fingers crossed I’m starting second half of chemo tomorrow x
Posts.Title: Fed Up!!

Posts.Content: Hi kaz I am triple negative too and also get occasional aches in my opposite armpit but only since I started chemo. My irrational brain says oh my god it’s spreading but my rational brain says probably just aching from chemo like the rest of my body. It’s a tough journey that’s for sure. All the best with your op and results xx
Posts.Title: Tumour didnt shrink. Finished chemo

Posts.Content: Hi hammie glad to hear you have the results now and an idea of the treatment plan. There are plenty of ladies on the chemo chat thread  if you want to get an idea of what chemo will be like. I am over halfway through 6 months of chemo. It seems daunting and a long road at the beginning but as soon as you get started it really will fly by. All the best for the rest of your scans and enjoy relaxing over Xmas. Xx
Posts.Title: Waiting, waiting, waiting

Posts.Content: Hi Allypops did you get any resolution on your swelling/bruising? I had my first EC on Wednesday and I don’t have bruising but my affected boob does feel swollen and almost firm. Very peculiar and I didn’t get anything like this on Paclitaxel/Carboplatin x
Posts.Title: Swelling and bruising during chemo (neo- adjuvant)

Posts.Content: P.s. if you have any questions as you go through the process I’m happy to help. I found that although the docs and nurses are great, it’s sometimes helpful to hear it from people that have gone through it x
Posts.Title: Waiting, waiting, waiting

Posts.Content: hi  hammie the waiting sucks but try not to worry. The breast mri is just to get a more accurate picture of what’s going on. For me all it did was give them a more accurate size of the lump as they couldn’t get that from mammogram or ultrasound. It may be different where you are but I didn’t get any calls appointments etc until after the results of the biopsy.  Take care and all the best for Monday xx
Posts.Title: Waiting, waiting, waiting

Posts.Content: I’m very impatient too so know how you feel. You will find that once you get the biopsy results things will suddenly happen very quickly which I think is a good thing. It’s just holding out till Monday via distraction! It’s good that you’re not scared. I was terrified but shouldn’t have been because things were a lot better once I knew what was going to be done about it. And none of the treatment is as scary as you imagine it to be (should you need it) x
Posts.Title: Waiting, waiting, waiting

Posts.Content: Thanks Allypops I will keep an eye on it. Did you get shrinkage of your lump on EC? X
Posts.Title: Swelling and bruising during chemo (neo- adjuvant)

Posts.Content: Thank you so much for coming back to me so quickly. Although I do have a supportive family it’s nice to speak to someone that is/has been there themselves. Provides a little relief! I guess what I don’t understand is if the cancer is only 2 millimetres then why is the actual lump 2 centimetres. Wouldn’t the whole thing be cancerous! Also I think at worst I was expecting him to tell me it looks “suspicious” and then biopsy it rather than saying outright it looks like a “small cancer” even before biopsy. The dodgy lymph node was a bit of an added surprise too. Thanks again for your calming words. Very much appreciated xx
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy results - breast cancer

Posts.Content: Thanks for getting back to me. Sounds like you were provided with more detailed info than me. My consultant didn’t want to speculate until the biopsy results came back other than to say it looked like a small cancer of 2 millimetres. Which doesn’t make sense now I’m home as the lump I can feel is bigger than that. I probably should have asked these things at the time but brain was too fuzzy.  Also I  think I had an MRI, rather than a mammogram, where they injected me with dye & that’s what picked up the small cancer. He didn’t specify much on my lymph node either other than to say it might be linked to cancer or just my body dealing with an unrelated infection. Wishing you all the best for Wednesday. Let me know how you get on. You’re very lucky to be married to a doctor!
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy results - breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi i went to my gp last week as i discovered a lump in the left hand side of my left breast. I’ve been conscious of this breast for a couple of months now Since noticing  pre menstrual aching in the breast only recently  but the lump itself doesn’t hurt. GP said the lump was about 2 centimetres, was moveable, and the skin wasn’t tethering so she thought most likely fibrocystic changes but referred me to the breast clinic.  I have had my appointment at the breast clinic . The nurse that examined me thought it was probably a deep cyst & then passed me to a consultant for ultrasound.  Ultrasound showed the lump was solid & therefore not a cyst and then he gave me a contrast enhanced digital mammogram. Consultant said the CEDM appears to show a “small cancer” on the lump, “about 2 millimetres” but the rest of the breast is fine. He then did an ultrasound in my armpit & found one slightly swollen lymph node. A biopsy of the lump & lymph node have been taken & I am back at the clinic next week for the results. He said swollen lymph node might not be related. I’ve had sore throat this week & could just be my body fighting that off.  I have a one year old baby & therefore am fearing the worst, especially as it appears the consultant seems to think  it’s cancer already just from looking at the CEDM even before the biopsy results have come in which worries me that this might be aggressive particularly as I’ve had a baby fairly recently.  If anyone can help calm my anxiety and fear I would be grateful. Thanks
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy results - breast cancer

Posts.Content: Wish I could be as optimistic as you. I think I spend 90% of the day convinced of the worst & 10% thinking maybe it will be ok. But can’t help thinking the reality is either way the treatment will be long & hard leaving me less able to look after my child
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy results - breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Jenny thank you for getting back to me & sorry to hear what you’ve been through but loving your optimism. I am 37 & had my daughter a year ago. What were your initial symptoms? I guess my mind is in over drive because the consultant mentioned that it can be more aggressive in younger women but then kind of laughed it off when I asked if I was going to die. My biggest concern is the swollen lymph node which I wasn’t aware of till the ultrasound as cant feel it. He said he couldn’t see cancer in it on the ultrasound but then biopsied it anyway.   Also don’t understand why the lump in breast is big enough to feel about 2 centimetres. But the iodine MRI showed the cancer as only 2 millimetres and called it a small cancer. Should have asked this at the time but just wanted to get out of there xx
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy results - breast cancer

Posts.Content: Eddiboy - your initial diagnosis sounds like it may be similar to mine. Although my consultant said the lump couldn’t be a cyst because it’s solid. However when I look online it suggests cysts can be solid and fluid  so god knows! I had the dye MRI after the ultrasound as he said the lump had some unusual characteristics at which point he said yes there appears to be a“small cancer “ about 2 millimetres (I’m assuming in the same place as the lump). So maybe I have a random lump with cancer cells at the tip. It’s a shame I couldn’t have just asked him these things at the time but your brain just goes to mush as soon as the C word comes out their mouth. I have been out today with family to talk it through and it really does help to pass the time at least & get some perspective. Thank you everyone on here for giving me some perspective& context  too. You’ve been lifesavers during moments when I’ve felt my brain might pop! Xx
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy results - breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Maggie  i had a breast MRI after the initial ultrasound, not a mammogram. From what I understand that looks for cancer cells rather than calcification. I could be wrong but he certainly never mentioned calcification and just called it 2mm small cancer which I assume is sitting on the lump that I can feel. Just have to hope it hasn’t spread to the swollen lymph node. Thanks for messaging and your kind words. Husband will come with me for biopsy results x
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy results - breast cancer

Posts.Content: Sorry, I had a contrast enhanced digital mammogram. I learn something new every day!
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy results - breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Kate  sorry to hear of your news but great to hear how you’re coping. I’m clinging onto the doctor calling it a small cancer of 2 millimetre but doesn’t change the fact that the biopsy results could say it’s  aggressive & that theres this bigger lump in there which I assume is part of the cancer. And that this lymph node could come back the same. Just feels like the odds are suddenly stacked against me with little hope.
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy results - breast cancer

Posts.Content: Thanks for getting back to me. I’m absolutely fearing the worst. Absolute torture and no idea how I’ll get through the results appointment x
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy results - breast cancer

Posts.Content: Thanks Bluebell. Seeing oncologist on Tuesday so will definitely mention it. It’s almost like it feels bigger first thing in the morning and then softens after a while. I’m doing ok but had to skip my last Paclitaxel due to all my bloods being too low. First time that’s happened. Fingers crossed they are back up this week as I start 4 EC. So I’m officially halfway through chemo now and glad to see the back of Paclitaxel. Just anxious that the chemo keeps doing it’s job and there’s no impact in me having missed a couple. Hope alls well with you xx
Posts.Title: Long shot

Posts.Content: Hi all. I am halfway through chemo for triple negative breast cancer and wanted to ask if someone has experienced similar to me. At my last check up they estimated my tumour has now shrunk by almost half. I’ve noticed over the last couple days that in the morning it almost feels gristly but then once I get up and about it softens again. Am I imagining it or has anyone noticed similar? Thanks all x
Posts.Title: Long shot

Posts.Content: I remember you saying about the pulmonary embolism. Sorry to hear it’s impacted things but I’m sure they will know a way around it. I bet it happens quite often. I can’t believe I’m halfway. It seems like only yesterday I was taking to you before I’d even started. In many ways it has gone quickly but I find it quite stressful having the chemo first as I can’t stop checking the blooming thing. Especially when I’ve missed a chemo it makes me more paranoid. Thanks for your encouraging words xxx
Posts.Title: Long shot

Posts.Content: Very true. Just wish I wouldn’t get so anxious about the three week check ups with the oncologist when they have a good rummage around  , I’m hoping the side effects from EC are no worse than the Paclitaxel xx
Posts.Title: Long shot

Posts.Content: Hi Lou1234 I am triple negative too. There is a triple negative group on here aswell , and although it isn’t as busy as this group i find it can be useful for advice and discussion on stuff that’s particularly related to triple negative. Someone always gets back to you. All the best with your treatment x
Posts.Title: Hello, I’m new to this and would love a friendly hello
